TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Math extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Class Math provides basic math constants and operations such as trigonometric functions, hyperbolic functions, exponential, logarithms, etc.

remarks.para: Class Math provides basic math constants and operations such as trigonometric functions, hyperbolic functions, exponential, logarithms, etc.

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Abs (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Abs(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the absolute value of the argument.

remarks.para: Returns the absolute value of the argument.

Special cases:
abs(-0.0) = +0.0
abs(+infinity) = +infinity
abs(-infinity) = +infinity
abs(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static int Abs (int i);
.method public static hidebysig int32 Abs(int32 i) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the absolute value of the argument.

remarks.para: Returns the absolute value of the argument.
If the argument is Integer.MIN_VALUE, Integer.MIN_VALUE is returned.

Docs.summary: Returns the absolute value of the argument.

Docs.param: the value to compute arc cosine of.
Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of the arc cosine of the argument within the range [0..pi].

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of the arc cosine of the argument within the range [0..pi]. The returned result is within 1 ulp (unit in the last place) of the real result.

Special cases:
acos((anything > 1) = NaN
acos((anything
acos(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Atan (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Atan(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.param: the value whose arc tangent has to be computed.
Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of the arc tangent of the argument within the range [-pi/2..pi/2].

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of the arc tangent of the argument within the range [-pi/2..pi/2]. The returned result is within 1 ulp (unit in the last place) of the real result.

Special cases:
atan(+0.0) = +0.0
atan(-0.0) = -0.0
atan(+infinity) = +pi/2
atan(-infinity) = -pi/2
atan(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Atan2 (double x, double y);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Atan2(float64 x, float64 y) cil managed

Docs.param: the denominator of the value whose atan has to be computed.
the numerator of the value whose atan has to be computed.
Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of the arc tangent of y/x within the range [-pi..pi].

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of the arc tangent of y/x within the range [-pi..pi]. This is the angle of the polar representation of the rectangular coordinates (x,y). The returned result is within 2 ulps (units in the last place) of the real result.

Special cases:
atan2((anything), NaN ) = NaN;
atan2(NaN , (anything) ) = NaN;
atan2(+0.0, +(anything but NaN)) = +0.0
atan2(-0.0, +(anything but NaN)) = -0.0
atan2(+0.0, -(anything but NaN)) = +pi
atan2(-0.0, -(anything but NaN)) = -pi
atan2(+(anything but 0 and NaN), 0) = +pi/2
atan2(-(anything but 0 and NaN), 0) = -pi/2
atan2(+(anything but infinity and NaN), +infinity)=+0.0
atan2(-(anything but infinity and NaN), +infinity)=-0.0
atan2(+(anything but infinity and NaN), -infinity) = +pi
atan2(-(anything but infinity and NaN), -infinity) = -pi
atan2(+infinity, +infinity ) = +pi/4
atan2(-infinity, +infinity ) = -pi/4
atan2(+infinity, -infinity ) = +3pi/4
atan2(-infinity, -infinity ) = -3pi/4
atan2(+infinity, (anything but,0, NaN, and infinity))=+pi/2
atan2(-infinity, (anything but,0, NaN, and infinity))=-pi/2

MemberSignature.Value: public static double CopySign (double p0, double p1);
.method public static hidebysig float64 CopySign(float64 p0, float64 p1) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a double with the given magnitude and the sign of sign.

remarks.para: Returns a double with the given magnitude and the sign of sign. If sign is NaN, the sign of the result is arbitrary. If you need a determinate sign in such cases, use StrictMath.copySign.

Docs.summary: Returns a float with the given magnitude and the sign of sign.

remarks.para: Returns a float with the given magnitude and the sign of sign. If sign is NaN, the sign of the result is arbitrary. If you need a determinate sign in such cases, use StrictMath.copySign.

.method public static hidebysig float64 Exp(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.param: the value whose exponential has to be computed.
Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of the raising "e" to the power of the argument.

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of the raising "e" to the power of the argument. The returned result is within 1 ulp (unit in the last place) of the real result.

Special cases:
exp(+infinity) = +infinity
exp(-infinity) = +0.0
exp(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Expm1 (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Expm1(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.param: the value to compute the ed- 1 of.
Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of ed- 1.

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of ed- 1. If the argument is very close to 0, it is much more accurate to use expm1(d)+1 than exp(d) (due to cancellation of significant digits). The returned result is within 1 ulp (unit in the last place) of the real result.
For any finite input, the result is not less than -1.0. If the real result is within 0.5 ulp of -1, -1.0 is returned.

Special cases:
expm1(+0.0) = +0.0
expm1(-0.0) = -0.0
expm1(+infinity) = +infinity
expm1(-infinity) = -1.0
expm1(NaN) = NaN

floor(+0.0) = +0.0
floor(-0.0) = -0.0

floor(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Hypot (double x, double y);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Hypot(float64 x, float64 y) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns sqrt(x2+y2).

remarks.para: Returns sqrt(x2+y2). The final result is without medium underflow or overflow. The returned result is within 1 ulp (unit in the last place) of the real result. If one parameter remains constant, the result should be semi-monotonic.

Special cases:
hypot(+infinity, (anything including NaN)) = +infinity
hypot(-infinity, (anything including NaN)) = +infinity
hypot((anything including NaN), +infinity) = +infinity
hypot((anything including NaN), -infinity) = +infinity
hypot(NaN, NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double IEEEremainder (double x, double y);
.method public static hidebysig float64 IEEEremainder(float64 x, float64 y) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the remainder of dividing x by y using the IEEE 754 rules.

remarks.para: Returns the remainder of dividing x by y using the IEEE 754 rules. The result is x-round(x/p)*p where round(x/p) is the nearest integer (rounded to even), but without numerical cancellation problems.

Special cases:
IEEEremainder((anything), 0) = NaN
IEEEremainder(+infinity, (anything)) = NaN
IEEEremainder(-infinity, (anything)) = NaN
IEEEremainder(NaN, (anything)) = NaN
IEEEremainder((anything), NaN) = NaN
IEEEremainder(x, +infinity) = x where x is anything but +/-infinity
IEEEremainder(x, -infinity) = x where x is anything but +/-infinity

Special cases:
log(+0.0) = -infinity
log(-0.0) = -infinity
log((anything
log(+infinity) = +infinity
log(-infinity) = NaN
log(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Log1p (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Log1p(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.param: the value to compute the ln(1+d) of.
Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of the natural logarithm of the sum of the argument and 1.

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of the natural logarithm of the sum of the argument and 1. If the argument is very close to 0, it is much more accurate to use log1p(d) than log(1.0+d) (due to numerical cancellation). The returned result is within 1 ulp (unit in the last place) of the real result and is semi-monotonic.

Special cases:
log1p(+0.0) = +0.0
log1p(-0.0) = -0.0
log1p((anything
log1p(-1.0) = -infinity
log1p(+infinity) = +infinity
log1p(-infinity) = NaN
log1p(NaN) = NaN

remarks.para: The double value closest to pi, the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Pow (double x, double y);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Pow(float64 x, float64 y) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of the result of raising x to the power of y.

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of the result of raising x to the power of y.

Special cases:
pow((anything), +0.0) = 1.0
pow((anything), -0.0) = 1.0
pow(x, 1.0) = x
pow((anything), NaN) = NaN
pow(NaN, (anything except 0)) = NaN
pow(+/-(|x| > 1), +infinity) = +infinity
pow(+/-(|x| > 1), -infinity) = +0.0
pow(+/-(|x|
pow(+/-(|x|
pow(+/-1.0 , +infinity) = NaN
pow(+/-1.0 , -infinity) = NaN
pow(+0.0, (+anything except 0, NaN)) = +0.0
pow(-0.0, (+anything except 0, NaN, odd integer)) = +0.0
pow(+0.0, (-anything except 0, NaN)) = +infinity
pow(-0.0, (-anything except 0, NAN, odd integer))=+infinity
pow(-0.0, (odd integer)) = -pow( +0 , (odd integer) )
pow(+infinity, (+anything except 0, NaN)) = +infinity
pow(+infinity, (-anything except 0, NaN)) = +0.0
pow(-infinity, (anything)) = -pow(0, (-anything))
pow((-anything), (integer))=pow(-1,(integer))*pow(+anything,integer)
pow((-anything except 0 and inf), (non-integer)) = NAN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Random ();
.method public static hidebysig float64 Random() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a pseudo-random double n, where n >= 0.0 && n .

remarks.para: Returns a pseudo-random double n, where n >= 0.0 && n . This method reuses a single instance of . This method is thread-safe because access to the Random is synchronized, but this harms scalability. Applications may find a performance benefit from allocating a Random for each of their threads.

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Rint (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Rint(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the double conversion of the result of rounding the argument to an integer.

remarks.para: Returns the double conversion of the result of rounding the argument to an integer. Tie breaks are rounded towards even.

Special cases:
rint(+0.0) = +0.0
rint(-0.0) = -0.0
rint(+infinity) = +infinity
rint(-infinity) = -infinity
rint(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static long Round (double d);
.method public static hidebysig int64 Round(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the result of rounding the argument to an integer.

remarks.para: Returns the result of rounding the argument to an integer. The result is equivalent to (long) Math.floor(d+0.5).

Special cases:
round(+0.0) = +0.0
round(-0.0) = +0.0
round((anything > Long.MAX_VALUE) = Long.MAX_VALUE
round((anything
round(+infinity) = Long.MAX_VALUE
round(-infinity) = Long.MIN_VALUE
round(NaN) = +0.0

.method public static hidebysig int32 Round(float32 f) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the result of rounding the argument to an integer.

remarks.para: Returns the result of rounding the argument to an integer. The result is equivalent to (int) Math.floor(f+0.5).

Special cases:
round(+0.0) = +0.0
round(-0.0) = +0.0
round((anything > Integer.MAX_VALUE) = Integer.MAX_VALUE
round((anything
round(+infinity) = Integer.MAX_VALUE
round(-infinity) = Integer.MIN_VALUE
round(NaN) = +0.0

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Signum (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Signum(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.param: the value whose signum has to be computed.
Docs.summary: Returns the signum function of the argument.

remarks.para: Returns the signum function of the argument. If the argument is less than zero, it returns -1.0. If the argument is greater than zero, 1.0 is returned. If the argument is either positive or negative zero, the argument is returned as result.

Special cases:
signum(+0.0) = +0.0
signum(-0.0) = -0.0
signum(+infinity) = +1.0
signum(-infinity) = -1.0
signum(NaN) = NaN

.method public static hidebysig float32 Signum(float32 f) cil managed

remarks.para: Returns the signum function of the argument. If the argument is less than zero, it returns -1.0. If the argument is greater than zero, 1.0 is returned. If the argument is either positive or negative zero, the argument is returned as result.

Special cases:
signum(+0.0) = +0.0
signum(-0.0) = -0.0
signum(+infinity) = +1.0
signum(-infinity) = -1.0
signum(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Tan (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Tan(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.param: the angle whose tangent has to be computed, in radians.
Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of the tangent of the argument.

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of the tangent of the argument. The returned result is within 1 ulp (unit in the last place) of the real result.

tan(+0.0) = +0.0
tan(-0.0) = -0.0

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Tanh (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Tanh(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.param: the value whose hyperbolic tangent has to be computed.
Docs.summary: Returns the closest double approximation of the hyperbolic tangent of the argument.

remarks.para: Returns the closest double approximation of the hyperbolic tangent of the argument. The absolute value is always less than 1. The returned result is within 2.5 ulps (units in the last place) of the real result. If the real result is within 0.5ulp of 1 or -1, it should return exactly +1 or -1.

Special cases:
tanh(+0.0) = +0.0
tanh(-0.0) = -0.0
tanh(+infinity) = +1.0
tanh(-infinity) = -1.0
tanh(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: protected override IntPtr ThresholdClass { get; }
.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static double ToDegrees (double angrad);
.method public static hidebysig float64 ToDegrees(float64 angrad) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the measure in degrees of the supplied radian angle.

remarks.para: Returns the measure in degrees of the supplied radian angle. The result is angrad * 180 / pi.

Special cases:
toDegrees(+0.0) = +0.0
toDegrees(-0.0) = -0.0
toDegrees(+infinity) = +infinity
toDegrees(-infinity) = -infinity
toDegrees(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double ToRadians (double angdeg);
.method public static hidebysig float64 ToRadians(float64 angdeg) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the measure in radians of the supplied degree angle.

remarks.para: Returns the measure in radians of the supplied degree angle. The result is angdeg / 180 * pi.

Special cases:
toRadians(+0.0) = +0.0
toRadians(-0.0) = -0.0
toRadians(+infinity) = +infinity
toRadians(-infinity) = -infinity
toRadians(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Ulp (double d);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Ulp(float64 d) cil managed

Docs.param: the floating-point value to compute ulp of.
Docs.summary: Returns the argument's ulp (unit in the last place).

remarks.para: Returns the argument's ulp (unit in the last place). The size of a ulp of a double value is the positive distance between this value and the double value next larger in magnitude. For non-NaN x, ulp(-x) == ulp(x).

Special cases:
ulp(+0.0) = Double.MIN_VALUE
ulp(-0.0) = Double.MIN_VALUE
ulp(+infinity) = infinity
ulp(-infinity) = infinity
ulp(NaN) = NaN

MemberSignature.Value: public static float Ulp (float f);
.method public static hidebysig float32 Ulp(float32 f) cil managed

Docs.param: the floating-point value to compute ulp of.
Docs.summary: Returns the argument's ulp (unit in the last place).

remarks.para: Returns the argument's ulp (unit in the last place). The size of a ulp of a float value is the positive distance between this value and the float value next larger in magnitude. For non-NaN x, ulp(-x) == ulp(x).

Special cases:
ulp(+0.0) = Float.MIN_VALUE
ulp(-0.0) = Float.MIN_VALUE
ulp(+infinity) = infinity
ulp(-infinity) = infinity
ulp(NaN) = NaN
